deck_description: My take on Blue-Eyes deck
This is the deck I made fo Para, one of the Paradox Brothers, for his tag team duel where he and his brother vs Yugi and Joey.
This is the deck that I built for Dox, one of the Paradox Brothers, for his tag team duel with his brother vs Yugi and Joey.

This is the deck I built for Kaiba's duel vs Yugi infront of Pegasus' castle. I made an exception to add Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon to this deck because this is the first time that Kaiba summons Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon in the series.

Hello! 

I am sorry if anyone was waiting on my deck for the last three months

Physics 300 and astronomy have been absolutely destroying my free time so I haven't really had time to post 

 

Anyway, this is the deck!

 

You are looking to go into giant ballpark, and usually, bagooska or dawn dragster-ing with an I:P. Turn after that you usually can clean up with ballpark and some other link monsters.
The lines in this deck are pretty self-explanatory. The only thing you do need to watch out for though, is dangers discarding your field spells or big four combo starter spells. You can discard almost anything else though, because inzektor link person can recycle your tech insect monsters. The tons of board breakers are so ball park hits harder, and the kaijus are searchable as well.

If you need to know anything, just let me know in the comments!

deck_excerpt: Burning Abyss in the modern era
deck_description: This is burning abyss updated for the modern era. It features orcust and phantom knight engines for extra disruption. The deck runs 45 cards for the extra resources because the deck sends so many cards to the graveyard. The main goal when going first is to set up fog blade(s) and dingirsu to paralyze your opponent. Sea archiver, psychic wheeleder, and edge imp sabers serve as extenders. Forbidden Droplet is a good board breaker which synergizes well with a deck that wants to discard certain cards to the graveyard while crippling the opponents field.

deck_excerpt: Success dependent on a Coin Toss
deck_description:
Dark Sage is a Level 9 DARK Spellcaster monster that must first be Special Summoned from your Deck by Tributing a Dark Magician you control on resolution of Time Wizard's effect in which you call the coin toss right. If you Special Summon Dark Sage this way, you can add any Spell from your Deck to your hand. This Deck aims to turbo out Dark Sage through Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights Summoning Armageddon Knight from Deck, sending Summoner Monk from Deck to GY, and reviving it with Number 60: Dugares the Timeless.

Full combo requires 2 cards: A way to get to Isolde and a way to get a Level 4 monster on field without using your Normal Summon. For example, let's say you have Vision HERO Vyon and Photon Thrasher. Special Summon Thrasher from hand and Normal Summon Vyon. On Normal Summon, Vyon dumps Destiny HERO Malicious from Deck to GY. Malicious banishes itself from GY to Special Summon another Malicious from Deck. Vyon and Maliciouos Link off into Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights. On Link Summon, Isolde adds a card we don't need to hand like Vyon or Thrasher. Isolde sends 4 Equip Spells from Deck to GY to Special Summon a Level 4 Warrior monster from Deck. I recommend at least sending Cursed Bamboo Sword or Phoenix Gearblade to get a Spell to hand. Cursed Bamboo Sword can add Broken Bamboo Sword from Deck to hand if it is sent to GY and Phoenix Gearblade adds itself from GY to hand if it is sent to Gy or banished to activate a monster effect. Isolde Special Summons Armageddon Knight from Deck, and on Special Summon, Armageddon Knight sends Summoner Monk from Deck to GY. Xyz Thrasher and Armageddon Knight into Number 60: Dugares the Timeless. Dugares detaches 2 Xyz Materials from itself to Special Summon Summoner Monk from GY in Defense Position. Summoner Monk discards a Spell from hand to Special Summon a Level 4 monster from Deck, being Rescue Ferret. Rescue Ferret shuffles itself back into Deck to Special Summon monsters from Deck whose total Levels equal 6 to zones a Link Monster points to with their effects negated, destroying them during the End Phase. Special Summon Time Wizard and Blue Dragon Summoner to the zones that Isolde points to. Link off Isolde and Time Wizard into Selene, Queen of the Master Magicians. Selene places Spell Counters on herself equal to the number of Spells on field and in GY on Link Summon which is usually 4 or 5 at this point. Selene then uses 3 Spell Counters to Special Summon Time Wizard back from GY in Defense to Linkpoint. Link Blue Dragon Summoner, Dugares, Summoner Monk, and Selene into a 4-material Saryuja Skull Dread. Since Saryuja was made with 4 materials, draw 4 cards and place 3 cards from your hand on the bottom of your Deck in any order. Use this as an opportunity to dig for copies of Second Coin Toss to ensure that your Time Wizard goes through. Blue Dragon Summoner also triggers to add a Normal Dragon, Spellcaster, or Warrior monster from Deck to hand, adding Dark Magician. Since Saryuja was made with at least 3 materials, it can Special Summon a monster from your hand. Use this effect to Special Summon Dark Magician from hand. Activate Time Wizard's effect and call it right. Special Summon Dark Sage from Deck by Tributing Dark Magician, and on Special Summon, Dark Sage will add World Legacy Monstrosity from Deck to hand. Activate targeting Dark Sage with Monstrosity to Special Summon Prediction Princess Bibliomuse and World Legacy Guardragon Mardark. Use Mardark and Dark Sage to Xyz Summon Mereologic Aggregator and on its Xyz Summon, use its effect to send Herald of the Arc Light from Extra Deck to GY. Because Herald is sent to GY, it can search for a Ritual Monster or Ritual Spell. Use this to search for Prediction Princess Tarotreith. Activate Aggregator’s other effect targeting Herald in GY, detach Mardark from Aggregator and attach Herald from GY to it. Link off Mereologic Aggregator and Saryuja into Lib the World Key Blademaster which we are able to do because World Legacy Guardragon Mardark is in GY. Herald is sent to GY again, so use it to search for a copy of Underworld Ritual of Prediction. Activate Underworld Ritual, tributing Bibliomuse on field in order to Ritual Summon Tarotreith from hand. Bibliomuse will trigger in GY off of being tributed and sent to GY. Special Summon it back to your field from GY in face-down Defense Position. Use Tarotreith’s effect to flip Bibliomuse face-up. Bibliomuse’s Flip Effect triggers which allows you to add a Prediction Princess and a Ritual Spell from Deck to hand. Search for another copy of Underworld Ritual of Prediction and a Prediction Princess Tarotrei. Activate that copy of Underworld Ritual you searched to Ritual Summon Tarotrei from hand by Tributing Tarotreith on field. Activate Lib’s effect to set World Legacy Succession from your Deck. Activate Succession to Special Summon back either Mardark or Dark Sage to Linkpoint. Xyz Summon Laevateinn, Generaider Boss of Shadows by using Bibliomuse and the monster you Summoned back. Proceed to your End Phase and Tarotrei will be able to Special Summon Tarotreith back from GY face-down. Moving onto your opponent’s turn, during their Standby Phase, activate Underworld Ritual in GY by banishing it to Special Summon a non-Ritual Prediction Princess from Deck face-down. If your opponent has no response, activate Tarotrei’s effect to change Tarotreith to face-up Attack Position. Underworld Ritual will Special Summon a Bibliomuse from Deck face-down. Tarotreith’s Flip Effect triggers to Special Summon Deus-X Krawler from Deck face-down. During your opponent’s Main Phase, use Tarotreith’s effect to flip up Deus-X and Bibliomuse to negate all activated monster effects on your opponent’s field and to search another Prediction Princess and another Ritual Spell. And you also have access to Laevateinn for removing cards from your opponent’s field. 

This Deck is a mess, so I'll cover each of the card clusters that go together. For the Prediction Princess portion of the Deck, we are playing 2 Prediction Princess Tarotrei, 1 Prediction Princess Tarotreith, 2 Prediction Princess Bibliomuse, and 3 Underworld Ritual of Prediction. We are playing a much smaller amount of Prediction Princess cards because we still want access to them, but we want to access them solely from the Deck. If you draw 1 piece, it is fine, but drawing more than that will mean that we are not drawing any combo pieces. To go with them, we have 2 World Legacy Guardragon Mardark and 2 Deus-X Krawler. Mardark is a Level 9 for World Legacy Monstrosity and is also a World Legacy monster in name to turn on Lib the World Key Blademaster. As for Deus-X, it will be Summoned off of Tarotreith.

For the Dark Sage package, we are playing 1 Dark Sage, 1 Dark Magician, 2 Blue Dragon Summoner, 2 Time Wizard, and 3 Second Coin Toss. Dark Sage can be Summoned straight from the Deck, so we only need the 1 copy. Dark Magician is searchable off of Blue Dragon Summoner which you will get off of Rescue Ferret. The same goes for Time Wizard, whom we are playing the Second Coin Tosses for as they help ensure that we call the toss right.

For the Isolde package, we are playing 2 Destiny HERO Malicious and 3 Vision HERO Vyon, 3 Neo Space Connector and 2 Neo-Spacian Aqua Dolphin, 1 Reinforcement of the Army, and 1 Armageddon Knight. Mali and Vyon get you to Isolde through 1 card and the same goes for Connector and Aqua Dolphin. Armageddon Knight is what we are getting off of Isolde. We are not playing the whole D.D.R. - Different Dimension Reincarnation and Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite mumbo jumbo because we only need the 1 send off of Armageddon Knight. For our Equips, we are playing 1 Broken Bamboo Sword, 1 Cursed Bamboo Sword, 1 Moon Mirror Shield, 1 Living Fossil, 1 Phoenix Gearblade, and 1 Overdone Burial. Living Fossil can just bring back a Level 4 or lower monster from GY if you do draw it. Overdone Burial discards a monster to target a monster in Gy whose Level is lower than the discarded monster's Level and Special Summon it. It's not great, but it is still a reborn spell at the end of the day that does something for us if we do accidentally open it. Cursed Bamboo Sword and Phoenix Gearblade both have the ability to add a Spell to your hand if sent to GY. Cursed Bamboo Sword gets you Broken Bamboo Sword from Deck to hand while Gearblade adds itself from GY back to hand. This ensures that you have a Spell in hand to discard to activate Summoner Monk's effect.

For the extra Level 4 enablers, we have 3 Photon Thrasher, 1 Instant Fusion, 3 Ready Fusion, and 1 Monster Reborn. Thrasher just Special Summons itself from hand if you control no monsters. Instant Fusion can get us Master of Ham, but it can also get us Karbonala Warrior which is Level 4 for a free Level 4 on field for us to use to make Dugares. The same goes for Ready Fusion. Reborn can bring back a Neo Space Connector that you used as Link Material for Isolde as long as you didn't add a Connector to hand off of Isolde's effect on Link Summon.

For everything else in the Main Deck, we have 2 Rescue Ferret, 3 Summoner Monk, 3 Magical Mallet, 3 Reload, 1 World Legacy Monstrosity, and 1 World Legacy Succession. Ferret can shuffle itself from field into Deck to Special Summon monsters from your Deck whose total combined Levels equal 6 to zones Link Monsters point to. This is how you are accessing Blue Dragon Summoner and Time Wizard as Summoner is a Level 4 and Time Wizard is a Level 2. You Special Summon Ferret from Deck through Summoner Monk who discards a Spell to Special Summon a Level 4 monster from Deck. Monk is what you are always going to be dumping off of Armageddon Knight so that Dugares can bring it back. Mallet and Reload allow you to try to correct your hand and it can also shuffle a Dark Sage back into Deck because you want that it in Deck as it is a hard brick. Monstrosity is searched off of Dark Sage on Summon and it is what gets you to Bibliomuse and Mardark from Deck. Succession is set from Deck off of Lib and it allows you to get a Level 9 back from Gy to have material for Laevateinn, Generaider Boss of Shadows.

Extra Deck: 1 Master of Ham which you usually don't summon even if you have Instant Fusion because Ham itself and the monster you get off of it blocks your zones which you need for Link Summoning and Rescue Ferret stuff. 1 Karbonala Warrior as an accessible Level 4. 1 Herald of the Arc Light which searches a Ritual Monster or Ritual Spell if sent to Gy. 1 Mereologic Aggregator which dumps Herald from Extra Deck on Xyz Summon and detaches to reattach Herald from GY for another send when sent to Gy. 1 Laevateinn, Generaider Boss of Shadows and 1 Jormungandr, Generaider Boss of Eternity for our Rank 9 interruption option. 1 Number 60: Dugares the Timeless which detaches 2 to Special Summon a monster from Gy which you use to get back Summoner Monk you dumped off of Armageddon Knight. 1 Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess which you could go into if you are interrupted and are unable to continue comboing. 1 Saryuja Skull Dread. We are using it's 3 mat effect to Summon Dark Magician from hand and using its 4 mat effect to dig for Second Coin Tosses. 1 Selene, Queen of the Master Magicians to Link off Time Wizard to refresh it as Ferret negates its effects. 1 Lib the World Key Blademaster to get us Succession to bring back a Level 9 for Rank 9 plays. 1 Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights to access Armageddon Knight. 1 S:P Little Knight, 1 I:P Masquerena, and 1 Dharc the Dark Charmer, Gloomy.

A modern karakuri build I've been brewing after the deck lost all of the aurorodon shenanigans and whatnot. I wanted to make a pure, honest build that didn't need to run engines like the machina junk and I think I mostly succeeded? Obviously the deck is ashable (and just interruptable in general in a lot of ways) but if they are unfamiliar with the deck (which a lot of people should be) then you could definitely play around ash on your merchant and you can also setup a negate before you go for your plays with the super heavy samurai engine. Speaking of which, as someone who skipped the meta where those were added to the game, this deck loves + 6 rotas that can also make baronne before your normal summon. Well I'm sure a lot of decks do but it's nice we get to play them and we even have some setups where we can unbrick booster out of hand by going into musashi. I'm sure this deck isn't anything to write home about but consistent + gets to play a lot of hand traps is usually a pretty decent recipe.

Your combos are pretty simple but it's basically merchant search bonze and then have any of barrel, gama, oil, another merchant, komachi, or cash cache in your hand (you can also search oil if you have bonze in hand already to combo). Alternatively komachi then cash cache to search merchant also combos. Your end board isn't crazy at all: 2 super shoguns with 1-2 gamas in gy (and 1 more super shogun if you drew an extra 3rd card for your combo), BUT your combo pieces replace themselves over the course of your combo thanks to steel shogun so you end with 4-5 cards in hand. In my testing I've never comboed off and only had the 2 interruptions at the end, you always draw into/start with at least a hand trap and often more. Usually you end turn 1 (assuming you weren't interrupted) with 4-5 forms of interruption and even if you were you still have your high handtrap count to fall back on.

Anyways, enjoy. Deck isn't perfect by any means and there are still a couple things I'm unsure I want to be on (like rafflesia) and some I would love to find room for (anatomy) but this was the best list I've been able to come up with.
Shoma Yusa's second Magikey Deck

This deck is a mashup of three different rank 7 axis archetypes: Kashtira, Armed Dragon and Dragon Ruler. Due to hits on the masterduel banlist, Kashtira is a middling deck on ladder, bricking constantly and folding to interruption very easily. It also struggles to put two 7's on board with out XYZ locking itself, preventing it from utilising galaxy tomahawk. By using only the good kashtira cards and instead combining them with an engine of Armed Dragons and Dragon rulers, you end up with a more consistent deck that can make galaxy tomahawk with ease, occasionally with protection due to sauravis. The decks main goal is to make galaxy tomahawk and end with Spright Elf, Borreload and Colossus with at least 2 but potentially 3 or 4 cards in hand left at the end. While stronger boards can be made by commiting more bricks into the main deck and synchros into the extra deck, it is often unnecessary and ruins any potential followup if the board is broken. It also makes room for toolbox XYZ like Dark Armed Dragon and Big Eye. After interruption or in a weak hand Kashtira Arise Heart or Voloferniges are strong backup plans. The dragon rulers in particular have great synergy with Arise-Heart, allowing them to trigger their effects when banished and then be recovered if they are detached from him. They are also good endboard pieces to extend into after the tomahawk line is done. The side deck is not tested due to the BO1 format and will need refining. This deck is quite modifiable depending on personal preference, with cards like Blaster, tidal and burner dragon rulers, Koaki Meiru Drago as a tempest search target, Pot of Prosperity and Armed Thunder Dragon Lvl 10 are all potential includes. Extra deck options such as mountain smasher, shangri-ira and draccossack are also very good. This is my personal favourite configuration of the deck, having got me to Master 4 playing a similar list last season.
Akaboshi Ohza's fist Deck

deck_excerpt: Summon Chaos Archfiend and dominate your opponent!
deck_description:
Hey everyone, Archfiend Guy here with a new Archfiend deck and this one uses the new and upcoming Berserk Archfiend! Berserk is a great card because it makes Pandemonium much more relevant, netting you extra searches, disruptions and a win condition with its ATK boost. The other win condition of the deck is to summon Chaos Archfiend to smack everything the opponent controls.

Turn one optimal disruptions:

  1. Chaos Archfiend into a Chaos Angel banish
  2. Fiendish Golem recurring banish
  3. Simul Archfiends for a D Barrier-esque lock
  4. Archfiend's Ghastly Glitch (pick this or Simul)
  5. Escape of the Unchained for a pop
  6. Wave High King Caesar for the double negate

4 card combo - Archfiend General, Unchained Twins Aruha, Berserk Archfiend, Abominable Chamber of the Unchained

  1. Set Chamber, pop with Aruha, Summon Sarama
  2. Activate Beserk Archfiend, target Aruha, Summon
  3. Aruha Summons Shyama from the deck
  4. Activate Archfiend General, search Pandemonium
  5. Activate Pandemonium
  6. Activate Sarama, set Chamber, pop Berserk
  7. Activate Pandemonium, search Archfiend Cavalry
  8. Link both Unchained into King Yama
  9. Search for Sharvara
  10. Normal Summon Cavalry
  11. Activate Sharvara, pop Yama, Summon
  12. Activate Shyama from GY, pop Cavalry
  13. Chain Link 1 Yama, CL2 Cavalry, CL3 Pandemonium
  14. Pandemonium searches Archfiend Heiress, Cavalry revives Archfiend General, Yama summons Cavalry
  15. Pop Cavalry off of Yama, CL1 Cavalry (revive Berserk Archfiend), CL2 Pandemonium (search Archfiend Heiress)
  16. Activate Shyama, target Berserk Archfiend, activate Pandemonium, search Bone Archfiend
  17. Link Sharvara + General into Muckraker
  18. Activate Sharvara, set Escape of the Unchained
  19. Activate Muckraker, target Sharvara, discard Heiress, revive
  20. Activate Heiress, search Simul Archfiends
  21. XYZ Shyama + Sharvara into Caesar
  22. Activate Bone Archfiend, remove Pandemonium or just discard, Summmon
  23. Activate Bone Archfiend's effect, target itself, send Vision Resonator (increase level)
  24. Vision Resonator, search Crimson Gaia, Crimson Gaia search Fiendish Golem
  25. Disruptions: Fiendish Golem, Escape, Caesar, Simul

3.5 card combo - Visas Samsara, Archfiend General, Unchained Twins Aruha

  1. Summon Visas Samsara, link into Light Heart
  2. Activate Light Heart, search Reichphobia
  3. Activate Reichphobia, search Reicheart
  4. Activate Reicheart, search Scareclaw Arrival
  5. Activate Arrival, revive Samsara
  6. Synchro into Chaos Archfiend
  7. Activate Archfiend General, search Pandemonium
  8. Activate Pandemonium
  9. Banish Reicheart + Samsara for Vicious Astraloud
  10. Activate Astraloud, pop Chaos Archfiend
  11. Activate Pandemonium, search Bone Archfiend
  12. Link Astraloud + Light Heart into Muckraker
  13. Activate Bone Archfiend, discard, Summon
  14. Activate Bone Archfiend, send Vision Resonator, search Crimson Gaia (activate), add Fiendish Golem
  15. Activate Aruha, target Bone Archfiend
  16. Activate Pandemonium, search Heiress
  17. Activate Muckraker, summon Chaos Archfiend, discard Heiress
  18. Activate Heiress, search Simul Archfiends
  19. Disruptions: Chaos Archfiend into Angel banish, Fiendish Golem, Simul Archfiends

2 card combo - Visas Samsara

  1. Summon Visas Samsara, link into Light Heart
  2. Activate Light Heart, search Reichphobia
  3. Activate Reichphobia, search Reicheart
  4. Activate Reicheart, search Scareclaw Arrival
  5. Activate Arrival, revive Samsara
  6. Synchro into Chaos Archfiend
  7. Activate Archfiend General, search Pandemonium
  8. Activate Pandemonium
  9. Banish Reicheart + Samsara for Vicious Astraloud
  10. Activate Astraloud, pop Chaos Archfiend
  11. Activate Pandemonium, search Heiress
  12. Link away Light Heart + Astraloud into Muckraker
  13. Activate Muckraker, revive Chaos Archfiend, discard Heiress
  14. Heiress search Simul Archfiends
  15. Disruptions: Chaos Archfiend into Angel banish + Simul

Packages:

Visas Samsara = 1 card combo into Chaos Archfiend

Incredible Ecclesia: Branded in High Spirits discards for effect, so grants us Heiress searches. We mainly use this to search out a level 4 light tuner for Chaos Archfiend. Fallen of Albaz is also a nice board breaker. Mirrorjade discarding Rindbrumm also fully sets up Chaos Archfiend the next turn (revive Fallen of Albaz, recycle Ecclesia).

You can easily remove the Ecclesia package if you want to go more pure. You can put in Archfiend's Roars, more Glitches, Falling Downs, Dark Spirits, take your pick!

Have fun :)
Try for fun!!

deck_name: A Study of Knights and Dragons
deck_excerpt: A 50-card exploration by a returning player
deck_description:
This is a 50-card deck exploring the Gaia the Dragon Champion archetype by a returning player. Despite the deck size going agatinst modern conventions, the practice hands seem pretty consistent in simulation at least.

It would be nice if I could squeeze some variant(s) of Black Luster Soldier in here without throwing the balance off too much so that I could fully utilize the potential of the deck or Dark Magician for the addition of Dark Magician the Knight of Dragon Magic to have all of the archetype (and easily sneak in the original Gaia the Dragon Champion with it), but I'm pretty happy with how this turned out otherwise.

Please feel free to tell me what you think!

deck_name: Clock Tower Prison w/ pure D-hero
deck_description:
Activate prison from hand or via favorite hero, fill up graveyard, summon high attack D-heroes for Dreadmaster, run over Departed and Dark angel.

D-tactics and Dreamer for backup.

When I was experimenting with Denglong, First of the Zang Zing and Accel Synchron in Prediction Princess with their ability to modifiy their own Levels by sending a specific monster from Deck to GY, I saw Angelica, Princess of Noble Arms which I remembered could enable a line to Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles which is a Level 9. Today, we are focusing on two Level 9's: Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles and Immortal Phoenix Gearfried. I originally was planning to write off Charles as a Level 9 Synchro you can simply just go into off of the Assault Mode package with Psi-Reflector back in my Synchro Prediction Princess list, but I have reconsidered because I completely forgot about the existence of the DUNE Infernoble Knight support up until they started topping recently. The new support provides a much easier time getting to Charles and even gives you more to work with in Emperor Charles the Great which essentially copies Charles' effect and adds on a Spell/Trap card/effect negate. Immortal Phoenix Gearfried was already easy to Summon as all you need to do is banish an Equip Spell from field or Gy to Special Summon it from hand. However, Equip Spells just don't go well in Prediction Princess because the ones that are generically good or are Ritual-related just act more as bricks unless you have a good way to access them with the same going for Immortal Gearfried. Access to Angelica basically gives you access to the whole Infernoble line. We cannot play Isolde, Two Tales of the Noble Knights in this Deck because we don't have space for starters which get you to Isolde and we definitely don't have space for the rest of the Equips to send off of Isolde. The benefit of playing Isolde in Infernoble is that she accesses a your combo pieces straight from the Deck which prevents you from having to actually draw all of the pieces of your combo. You only need to get to Angelica in order to facilitate the rest of your Infernoble combo, so you realistically only need to play a small Infernoble package and have a lot of room for non-engine in the Deck. We don't get that benefit in this Deck as we can't play Isolde and have to actually draw our combo pieces. However, that isn't too difficult as we have a lot of ways to actually search for our combo pieces. The only card that is relatively harder to search is World Legacy Monstrosity because you are very easily able to access your Infernoble stuff through cards like Noble Arms Museum, "Infernoble Arms - Durendal", Heritage of the Chalice, Reinforcement of the Army, and even Terraforming and Pot of Prosperity to get to those cards. Full combo requires you to have access to Angelica as well as World Legacy Monstrosity. However, if you do draw Immortal Phoenix Gearfried and are able to Summon him while you have Monstrosity in hand, you achieve full combo as well, just possible not along with the benefits of going through and ending on the Infernoble line. 

For the Main Deck: 3 Prediction Princess Tarotrei, 1 Prediction Princess Tarotreith, and 3 Prediction Princess Bibliomuse. Tarotrei can Quick Effect flip a monster on field face-up or face-down and during the End Phase, she can Special Summon a Flip Monster from hand or GY face-down. Tarotreith must be either Ritual Summoned or Special Summoned via Tarotrei's End Phase effect. Her Flip Effect allows you to Special Summon a Flip Monster from Deck face-down and while she is on field, she can Quick Effect flip any of your monsters face-up or face-down. Bibliomuse can Special Summon herself back from Gy if she was Tributed and sent there. Her Flip Effect allows you to add a Prediction Princess monster other than herself and a Ritual Spell from Deck to hand and while she is face-up on field, she gives your Ritual Monsters targeting and destruction protection from your opponent's effects. 2 Deus-X Krawler which negates all activated monster effects on your opponent's side of the field after is has been flipped face-up and if it is destroyed on field, you can search for a Level 9 monster with a different Type and Attribute than it. 1 Immortal Phoenix Gearfried which can be Special Summoned from hand by banishing an Equip Spell from field or GY. If it attacks, it can equip a face-up monster on the field to itself as an Equip Spell that gives it 500 ATK at the start of the damage step. And when a monster effect is activated, you can send a face-up Equip Spell you control to the Gy to negate the activation and destroy that monster. If you are able to draw this and Monstrosity with the ability to Summon it right on the spot, you will have immediate access to all of your Prediction Princess plays. And while that does come with a monster negate along with your Prediction Princess plays, you really don't need a monster negate when you have access to Deus-X Krawler. If you are unable to get to your Infernoble lines but have Immortal Gearfried, that gives you a way to potentially have the ability to do all of your Prediction Princess combos. For your Infernobles, we are playing 3 Infernoble Knight Ogier, 3 Infernoble Knight Turpin, and 3 Infernoble Knight - Renaud. Ogier sends a Noble Arms or FIRE Warrior monster from Deck to GY on Normal or Special Summon. This can help you get Turpin into the GY so it can Summon itself back or so that you can target Angelica to attempt to Equip Turpin to trigger Angelica. Ogier can also Equip itself to a Warrior monster from GY to give that monster protection from being destroyed by card effects. Turpin can Special Summon itself from hand or GY if you control a monster equipped with an Equip Card but it is banished if it leaves field if you Summoned it from GY. You can also equip it from GY to a Warrior monster you control as an Equip Spell that allows you to treat the equipped monster as a Tuner if used as Synchro Material. Because Turpin is often just a free Summon, it is nice to max out on him, especially since we need as free Summons to get to Angelica as we do need to draw all of our combo pieces for Infernoble. Renaud can Special Summon itself from hand as a Tuner if you control a FIRE Warrior monster and if it is Special Summoned you can target a FIRE Warrior in GY or an Equip Spell that is banished or in Gy to add it back to hand. This is good if you use Ogier to dump a card like "Infernoble Arms - Durendal" to add it back for a search, Turpin for a free Summon and since you added it back to hand, Special Summoning it from hand will put it back into the Gy when it leaves field and not banish it, or you can send Immortal Phoenix Gearfried to add it back and Summon it for either a monster negate or a Monstrosity target. 

For the Spell/Traps: 1 Instant Fusion for Master of Ham. As much I would like to play a Level 4 FIRE Warrior Fusion target for Instant Fusion to get material for Angelica, there doesn't exist one. 3 Underworld Ritual of Prediction which Ritual Summons a Prediction Princess Ritual Monster from hand or GY face-up or face-down and you can banish it from GY during the Standby Phase to Special Summon a non-Ritual Prediction Princess from Deck face-down. 3 World Legacy Monstrosity which can either Special Summon a Level 9 monster from hand or target a Level 9 monster you control and Special Summon 2 Level 9 monsters from Deck with a different Type and Attribute than it and with different names. 1 Terraforming. 3 Noble Arms Museum which is a soft once per turn that allows you to pay 1200 Life Points to add a Noble Arms card from Deck to hand except itself. It has another soft once per turn that allows you to target a Noble Knight Monster Card in your Spell/Trap Zone and Special Summon it but you cannot Special Summon monsters for the rest of the turn if you did not control Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles on activation. Museum searches you for Durendal which gets you a search for a Level 5 or lower FIRE Warrior to access your plays. And it being able to Special Summon a Noble Knight from your Spell/Trap Zone gets you your Emperor Charles that you equipped to Charles the Great so that you can make use of Charles the Great as a Spell/Trap negate while also getting Emperor Charles back onto the field as a Level 9 target for World Legacy Monstrosity. 3 "Infernoble Arms - Durendal" which can add a Level 5 or lower FIRE Warrior from Deck to hand while equipped and destroys itself afterwards. If it is sent to Gy because the equipped monster is sent to the Gy, you can target and Special Summon back a Level 5 or lower FIRE Warrior monster from GY at the cost of Warrior-locking you for the rest of the turn. 3 Heritage of the Chalice which adds a Noble Arms or Noble Knight card from your Deck or GY to your hand. And if a Noble Knight monster that's equipped with a Noble Arms Equip Spell is destroyed by battle and sent to GY, you can add this card from GY to hand. 1 Reinforcement of the Army and 3 Pot of Prosperity.

Extra Deck: 1 Master of Ham which Special Summons a Flip Monster from Deck face-down on Fusion Summon. 1 Cloudcastle which is a card that you can make on a following turn which Special Sumons back a Level 9 monster from GY on Synchro Summon for a Rank 9 play. 1 Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles which pops a cardon field if an Equip Card becomes equipped to a monster on field and it can Equip an Equip Spell from hand or Gy and then Equip a FIRE Warrior monster from Deck to itself during the End Phase. 2 Infernoble Knight Captain Roland which we are always Summoning off of Angelica and as a Quick Effect during the Main Phase, he can Equip himself from GY to a Warrior monster you control to give it 500 ATK. This triggers Emperor Charles or Charles the Great that copied the effect of Emperor Charles on your opponent's turn. 1 Angelica, Princess of Noble Arms which adds a Horn of Olifant or a card that mentions Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles from Deck to hand where our only target is Noble Arms Museum. Also, if Angelica is targeted for an attack or by a card or effect while on field, she can Quick Effect send a FIRE Warrior monster from your Deck to the GY and banish herself until the End Phase to Special Summon a Roland monster from Deck or Extra Deck. We are always getting Infernoble Knight Captain Roland with this effect to have access to a Level 5 Tuner, which when combined with a Level 4 non-Tuner, gets you to Emperor Charles. 2 Herald of the Arc Light which adds a Ritual Monster or Ritual Spell to hand if sent to GY. 1 Mereologic Aggregator. So how are we getting Aggregator into the GY when we can't make Gravity Controller with it as Charles the Great is going to be in our EMZ and since Masquerena cannot use Link Monsters as material? Well, you can just use an Infernoble Knight's effect in GY to equip to Charles the Great, proccing its effect to pop a card on field to pop Aggregator and get it and the Herald it has attached into GY for a search. 1 Laevateinn, Generaider Boss of Shadows and 1 Jormungandr, Generaider Boss of Eternity. 1 S:P Little Knight, 1 I:P Masquerena, and 1 Gravity Controller. And 1 Emperor Charles the Great which requires a Level 9 Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles that's equipped with an Equip Card as Link Material. On Link Summon, you can target and Equip Emperor Charles from GY to Charles the Great to change its name to Infernoble Knight Emperor Charles and gain its effects, and gains 500 ATK. Also, Charles the Great is a soft once per turn Spell/Trap card/effect negate by sending an Equip Spell from hand or face-up field to GY to negate the activation and destroy the card. This is great against non-targeting Spell/Traps that may deal with your board like Evenly Matched since Bibliomuse can't deal with those cards.

Side Deck: 3 Nibiru, the Primal Being, 2 Kashtira Fenrir, 1 Called By the Grave, 2 Lightning Storm, 1 Harpie's Feather Duster, 3 Evenly Matched, and 3 Infinite Impermanence.
AAA

deck_excerpt: Not rly, but IDK what else to call it
deck_description:
This isn't really "Synchron Prediction Princess", but I really don't know what else to call it. This Deck utilizes an engine that I like to call the World Legacy engine which is a 1-card combo that gets you to World Legacy Monstrosity while also setting you up for a good position to go into a Level 9 Synchro monster to turn on said Monstrosity. I would be calling it the "Knightmare engine" but since Knightmare Mermaid is banned, we can't really call it that, as with Mermaid, it is a 1-card combo to both Monstrosity and a Level 9 on field in Knightmare Incarnation Idlee which you get from Deck with Mermaid. I always knew that this engine was a thing but I really never experimented with it much because I just felt like not even attempting to do anything with it while Mermaid is banned. So, Girsu, the Orcust Mekk-Knight serves as a 1-card combo to get you to World Legacy Monstrosity and also gives you adequate set-up to go into a Level 9 Synchro monster to have a target on field for the Monstrosity you searched for. Normal Summon Girsu and activate its effect on Summon to send an Orcust or World Legacy card from Deck to GY. Send a copy of World Legacy - "World Armor" from your Deck to the GY. Since you control no other monsters, you can Special Summon a World Legacy Token to both player's field in Defense. Link off Girsu and the Token to go into Lib the World Key Blademaster which we are able to do because we have a World Legacy card in GY. And because a World Legacy monster is in GY, we can activate Lib's effect to set a World Legacy Spell/Trap from Deck which you are using to get a copy of World Legacy Succession. If you get World Legacy Monstrosity with this effect, you are not able to actually activate it, even if you already have a World Legacy monster in GY which you do, because it's a Quick-Play Spell, meaning that it cannot be activated the turn it is set. With our set copy of Succession, we Special Summon back World Armor to a Zone Lib points to. World Armor on Special Summon searches for a World Legacy card from Deck, getting you Monstrosity. Now, if Knightmare Mermaid were legal, we would Link off Lib and World Armor into Knightmare Cerberus or Knightmare Phoenix, Link whatever we Summon into Knightmare Mermaid, discard a card and Special Summon Knightmare Incarnation Idlee to our field from Deck. But that isn't possible, so what we can do after getting Monstrosity off of World Armor is Special Summon Assault Synchron from hand and Synchro it with World Armor into a Synchro 9 for a target on field for Monstrosity. So what are we playing the Synchron cards for? Other than Assault Synchron who we are using to Synchro into a Synchro 9, we are using Junk Converter to either search for Assault Synchron for the aformentioned reasons or to search Junk Synchron in order to Normal Summon and bring back said Converter to go into Accel Synchron. Just like Denglong, First of the Yang Zing, Accel Synchron can send a monster from Deck to GY to modify its Level. While Denglong sends a Wyrm from Deck to GY to copy its Level, Accel Synchron sends a Synchron monster from Deck to GY to either increase or decrease its Level by the Level of the sent monster. We are sending the Level 4 Stardust Synchron (because IDK why you would choose to play Hyper Synchron, Road Synchron, or Bri Synchron) in order to increase Accel Synchron's Level by 4, making it a Level 9, meaning that it can now be targeted with Monstrosity. Another benefit of playing the Synchron stuff is because it gives you a good Small World bridge to either Girsu or Assault Synchron. There's nothing really special about this Deck other than being able to actually search for Monstrosity easily and consistently, but I guess you could compare it somewhat to Ham Prediction Princess. However, while this Deck gives you good Monstrosity access, if you are unable to access Girsu or Prediction Princess plays, you really have nothing to work with as opposed to what you can do in Ham Prediction Princess. 

For the monsters: We are playing 3 Prediction Princess Tarotreith, 1 Prediction Princess Tarotrei, and 3 Prediction Princess Bibliomuse. Tarotreith must be either Ritual Summoned or Special Summoned by Tarotrei's End Phase effect. Her Flip Effect allows you to Special Summon a Flip Monster from Deck face-down and she can Quick Effect flip any number of your monsters face-up or face-down. Tarotrei can Quick Effect flip a monster face-up or face-down and can Special Summon a Flip Monster from hand or GY face-down during the End Phase. Bibliomuse can Special Summon herself back from the GY if she is tribtued and sent there. Her Flip Effect adds you a Prediction Princess other than herself and a Ritual Spell from Deck and while face-up on field, she gives your Ritual Monsters targeting and destruction protection from your opponent's effects. 2 Deus-X Krawler which negates all activated monster effects on your opponent's side of the field after it has been flipped face-up. And if it is destroyed on field, you can add a Level 9 monster from Deck with a different Type and Attribute than it. 1 World Legacy - "World Armor" which can Special Summon itself from hand when a monster is Flip Summoned. You are usually never going to be able to do this because when you flip a monster using an effect like Tarotrei's or Tarotreith's, that is not a Flip Summon, meaning that World Armor does not trigger. So, you are usually only going to be Special Summoning it with Lib setting Succession like I explained earlier. On Normal or Special Summon, it can add a World Legacy card from Deck to hand which is always going to be World Legacy Succession. It's last effect is not relevant as we are never going to be Normal Summoning or Setting this card. 3 Girsu, the Orcust Mekk-Knight which dumps an Orcust or World Legacy card from Deck on Normal Summon and if you control 2 or more other cards its column, you can treat it as a Tuner this turn. All you need to worry about this effect is dumping World Armor from Deck with it. If you control no other monsters, Girsu can also Special Summon a World Legacy Token to both fields in Defense. 1 Stardust Synchron which we need to send off of Accel Synchron to modulate its Level. Accel Synchron can only send from Deck which means that we need to keep Stardust Synchron in Deck if we are going through with that line. 3 Junk Synchron which Special Summons back a Level 2 or lower monster from GY in Defense with its effects negated on Normal Summon. 3 Junk Converter which sends itself and a Tuner from hand to GY to search for a Synchron monster. You are either getting Junk Synchron or Assault Synchron with this. And it is sent to GY as Synchro Material, you can target a Tuner in GY and Special Summon it in Defense but you cannot activate its effects this turn. If anything the monster you Summon back is extra Link Material to go into I:P alongside the Aggregator you possibly make. 2 Assault Synchron which you can Special Summon from hand and take 700 damage and it also Synchro locks you while its on the field this way. This along with World Armor turns into a Synchro 9 for Monstrosity. 

For Spell/Traps: 3 Underworld Ritual of Prediction which Ritual Summons a Prediction Princess Ritual Monster from hand or GY face-up or face-down and you can banish it from GY to Special Summon a non-Ritual Prediction Princess monster from Deck face-down. 2 Tuning which adds a Synchron Tuner from Deck and then sends the top card of the Deck to the GY. This basically acts as your extra copies of Assault Synchron or even Junk Synchron if necessary. 2 World Legacy Monstrosity which can either Special Summon a Level 9 from hand or target a Level 9 you control and Special Summon 2 Level 9's from Deck with a different Type and Attribute than it with different names. 1 World Legacy Succession to be set off of Lib which Special Summons a monster from GY to a zone a Link Monster points to. 3 Small World. 1 Instant Fusion for Master of Ham. 3 Pot of Prosperity and 3 Infinite Impermanence. 

Extra Deck: 1 Master of Ham. 1 Psychic End Punisher as we can make it with Assault Synchron and a Level 9. 1 Cloudcastle and 1 Ravenous Crocodragon Archethys which are our Synchro 9's. Cloudcastle on Synchro Summon brings back a Level 9 from GY and Crocodragon draws a card. 1 Accel Synchron which can send a Synchron monster from Deck to GY to increase or decrease its Level by the Level of the sent monster. 2 Herald of the Arc Light which searches for a Ritual Monster or Ritual Spell if sent to GY. 2 Mereologic Aggregator, 1 Laevateinn, Generaider Boss of Shadows, and 1 Jormungandr, Generaider Boss of Eternity. 1 S:P Little Knight which we can Link off Aggregator and Lib to go into. It's not as good as using I:P to go into it on your opponent's turn, but it is still interruption and a generic Link. 1 I:P Masquerena. 1 Lib the World Key Blademaster which can only be made while you have a World Legacy card in GY. During your Main Phase, you can set a World Legacy Spell/Trap from Deck but it cannot be activated unless you have a World Legacy monster in GY, and if it is sent to the GY as Link Material, you can shuffle a card on field into the Deck, including the World Legacy Token you gave your opponent off of Girsu to prevent your opponent from possibly using it as Link Material themselves. And finally, 1 Gravity Controller. 

Side Deck: 3 Nibiru, the Primal Being, 3 Thunder King, the Lightningstrike Kaiju, 1 Called By the Grave, 2 Lightning Storm, 3 Evenly Matched, and 3 Solemn Judgment.
Check https://www.masterduelmeta.com/top-decks/master-v/december-2023/odd-eyes/entertainer/cWAx9 for some comentaries
Yeah getgud

This is a basic traptrix deck for someone who is planning on getting into the game. It is a decent deck with insane value.

Start with getting 3 x Traptrix Structure Decks, then buy the rest of the cards individually.

The Fire Kings structure deck (release date 8/12/2023) will include infinite impermenance, solemn judgement, and droll & lock bird; so if you want you can just buy 3 x Fire Kings Structure Decks to get those cards AND have another archetype you can play with in the future.

Zeus is likely to get a price drop after the release of the "2-Player Starter Set" (release date 26/1/2024), so you can wait and get it then.

 

Main Deck

41 cards as I wanted to add a copy of "Terrifying Trap Hole Nightmare" without getting rid of anything else. It comes quite in handy in certain situations.

Shade Brigandine is preferrable over parallel eXceed due to various reasons such as it being a trap means SP little knight cant target it, and when used as material for time thief redoer it lets you remove an enemy card from the field. It also can activate Sera's effect.

Nibiru is in main because it is quite useful for several matchups that are generally quite bad for traptrix. You can get rid of the token by special summoning pudica or using redoer's effect (detach trap).

Both holeutea and shade when detached from redoer count as traps.

 

Extra Deck

Aussa is mainly for fenrir. If no one in your locals is using him, switch her out for a 3rd sera or some generic rank 4 (e.g. Evilswarm Exciton Knight).

Super Starslayer TY-PHON - Sky Crisis would be highly recommended for this slot as well if you dont mind the price.

deck_excerpt: Drawing so much you'll look like Rembrandt
deck_description: Made this in about 5 minutes. If you have a group of friends you play YuGiOh with and who don't care about banlists, then this is the perfect way to immediately make sure you no longer have any friends to play YuGiOh with. There's probably ways to optimize the deck, but with how much you'll be cycling (and considering it will never be legal), does it really matter?

New strategies emerge as the meta evolves! This variant plays Salamangreat Raging Phoenix, Promethean Princess, Bestower of Flames, and Worldsea Dragon Zealantis to enable an OTK if the opponent controls at least 1 monster that can be special summoned from the banished zone.

Raging Princess Zealantis OTK Combo Example

1. Normal Summon Snake-Eye Ash and use its effect to search for Snake-Eyes Populus.

2. Activate Populus' effect to special summon itself from the hand.

3. Activate Populus' effect to search for the Original Sinful Spoils - Snake-Eye.

4. Link summon Linkuriboh by using Populus as material. Activate Populus' effect to place itself face-up as a continuous spell.

5. Activate Snake-Eye Ash's effect to send itself and Populus to the graveyard to special summon Snake-Eyes Flamberge Dragon from the hand or deck.

6. Link summon Pitknight Earlie by using Flamberge Dragon and Linkuriboh as material. Activate Flamberge Dragon's effect to special summon Snake-Eye Ash and Populus from the graveyard.

7. Link summon Promethean Princess, Bestower of Flames by using Pitknight Earlie and either Snake-Eye Ash or Populus to the graveyard as material. Snake-Eye Ash is used in this example.

8. Activate Promethean Princess' effect to special summon Pitknight Earlie from the graveyard.

9. Link summon Salamangreat Raging Phoenix by using Promethean Princess and Populus as material.

10. Link summon Worldsea Dragon Zealantis by using Raging Phoenix as material.

11. Activate Zealantis' effect to banish all monsters on the field and special summon them back.

12. Promethean Princess' effect activates because a monster was special summoned to the opponent's field. Target and destroy Pitknight Earlie and the opponent's monster to special summon Promethean Princess to Zealantis' right zone.

13. Raging Phoenix's effect activates because a fire monster you control was destroyed. Target Pitknight Earlie to have Raging Phoenix gain 1500 attack and special summon it to another zone except Zealantis' left zone.

The current board is Zealantis, Promethean Princess, and a boosted Raging Phoenix, which translates to [2500 + 2700 + (2800 + 1500)] = 9500 battle damage. During the battle phase, a co-linked Zealantis can quick effect destroy 1 card on the field. During the end phase, Pitknight Earlie can special summon herself to Zealantis' left zone for the rare follow-up. While you control Flamberge Dragon, you can use its effect to place a monster in your graveyard as a face-up continuous spell on your field and extend plays with the Original Sinful Spoils - Snake-Eye in hand. Some alternative link monsters for this combo are Relinquished Anima for Linkuriboh and I:P Masquerena or S:P Little Knight for Pitknight Earlie.

On Fire King

The Fire King archetype provides more consistency and extenders for fire decks. Sacred Fire King Garunix and the Legendary Fire King Ponix can extend plays by special summoning themselves if a fire monster is destroyed. Fire King High Avatar Kirin helps your fire playstarters avoid Effect Veiler and Infinite Impermanence by quick effect destroying them to special summon himself from the hand. Fire King Avatar Arvata holds the line with his powerful monster effect negation. Fire King Island, which Fire King Sanctuary searches for, can combo well with your fire monsters by destroying a monster in your hand or field to search for a Fire King monster. Fire King Sky Burn can destroy cards on the field and protect your Fire King card(s) from card effect destruction with its graveyard effect. Garunix Eternity, Hyang of the Fire Kings is a mighty boss monster that breaks boards with ease.

On Sinful Spoils

The Sinful Spoils archetype also provides more consistency and extenders for decks that use level 1 fire monsters. Diabellstar the Black Witch can send a card from your hand or field to the graveyard to special summon herself from the hand and search for the Original Sinful Spoils - Snake-Eye on her normal or special summon. The Original Sinful Spoils - Snake-Eye can special summon a level 1 fire monster from the hand or deck by sending 1 other card from your field to the graveyard. WANTED: Seeker of Sinful Spoils can search for Diabellstar the Black Witch.

On Snake-Eye

The Snake-Eyes archetype naturally pairs well with the Sinful Spoils. Bonfire can search for Snake-Eye Ash and Populus. Snake-Eye Ash can search for a level 1 fire monster such as the Legendary Fire King Ponix or Populus if it is normal or special summoned. Populus can turn Bonfire into an extender because it can special summon itself from the hand if searched and on normal or special summon search for the Original Sinful Spoils - Snake-Eye. Flamberge Dragon is a strong monster whose unique effects can remove an opponent's monster with targeted, non-destruction and special summon monsters from the field and/or graveyard.

Side Deck Tech

Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion protects your graveyard from disruption. D.D. Crow and Soul Release, which is searchable with Triple Tactics Thrust, are good against graveyard focused decks. Dimensional Barrier, which is also searchable with Triple Tactics Thrust, is a general-purpose trap that can devastate specialized decks.
I opted for more consistency, side pattern needs changing but it is important to keep Spright Smashers and Spright Jet
